comment: Too sweet.... reminiscent of Alabama bourbon..... Cunecah Ridge aka Clyde Mayes

9/23/16 Grape & Grain Liquors, Kerrville, TX
$76.99

Love seeing an offering from Texas with promise, but this one is young and far from being worth the price for the taste. Pay for the experience and colectibility now and the flavors will come.
Just too young and sweet.  Love the cowboy. This one falls short. Wayyyyy better than upstate bourbons

Day 10. Sorry I'm late, had guests...again. At least they brought Rum. Good Rum. Today we got a Texas Whiskey. And unfortunatly, another disappointing bourbon. On the nose, there is banana. A lot óf it. Some Corn, oak, and caramelizing sugar. Not quite caramel, not quite sugar, somewhere in between. Taste is very bitter, oak spices, brown sugar. Not very smooth, this one fights you going down. After a while there are some dark chocolate notés. Short, sugary aftertaste. Not to my liking, but even whisky you don't like is worth trying just for the sake of expieriencing variety. There are better bourbons out there, at least in my opinion.
No thanks, ordered a pour via a recommendation.  It has that “play doh” noise as do most young bourbons, keep it in the barrel another 8 years or so :(

nose has noticeable heat, leather / peanut butter, cereal grain, brown sugar
leather / peanut butter carries through from aroma, hot, medium high sweetness carries into finish
Nose - Corn, wheat, cereal and cornmeal.  Taste - Big sweet corn, oily mouth feel, caramel, chocolate,
Oak, some stone fruit, and a burn on the finish; very light body; with water, more oak, and turpentine

i have had a few glasses after a visit to the distillery, which is beautiful, however, the whiskey produced in hye is not of top quality. at $80+ a bottle I expectantly more complex and flavorful whiskey. this bottle offers spice and smoke, not much else. at this price point, you can buy 2 bottles of 10 year old single malt

Nose:corn and slight brown sugar are expressed. Second smell: thanks to comments...bananas. Most evident corn followed by banana. Palate: Sweet with slight bite, cornmeal and vanilla exert themselves. Finish: smooth as molasses and we'll rounded, lingering cornmeal makes me picture Texas Cornfields and sunshine. Chainsaw Massacre not included.
Soft entry but lacking richness and sweetness. Tastes a little young, but not hot. I do like the cinnamon finish, but overall not worth $80
Bold on the front end, but smooth and enjoyable

Tasting the 2018 Spring Release. 
This Bourbon just never disappoints. I have really enjoyed every release I have tried.
Upon entry you get a pronounced cereal note with some brown sugar. It then rolls over to some mild baking spices with some toffee. Finish is long with some oak and heat. Lovely dram. Complexity defies is short 3 yrs of aging. 
The price point is high, but this is for sure different and very, very drinkable. Solid 4/5.
A little hot with a rich caramel, very well balanced.  Suitable neat, rocks, or mixed.

Sweet corn, nose was leather early.
Medium heat and finish that’s sweet cereal corn vanilla 
Solid
I tasted the 2018
Vanilla and oak, mild spice is good, has a bad after taste that lingers! Super over prices and should code around $20! Not great, don't waste your money
sweet cornbread and honey, some vanilla and oak, mild spice on the finish that lingers a bit. Maybe a bit overpriced but I could see myself buying it again.
Taste is good for a Texas bourbon but not for the price.
Lite burn, sweet on the tongue, long slow burn but lite on the pepper, more roof of the mouth than back of the throat.

I got the 2019. Odd taste (almost foul) at first. Then sweet caramel which helped. This will probably get better in time. There are many other whiskeys (Texas ones at that) I’d buy up to this price point of $80+ before I’d get this again
Sweet, excellent on the nose, but harsh, burns as it goes down. Not over powering. A bit of water works well.
Great smooth hefty bourbon, Carmel,oak,leathery, Texas
Tried this and the 2016. Both had a big clay-like flinty taste. I found it really off-putting. Probably the biggest disappointment of the year. I had very high expectations
